shortDescription: Daily study sessions for skill development, career advancement, and cognitive growth
scientificBenefits: Increased career opportunities and earning potential
Better cognitive flexibility and learning capacity
Greater sense of accomplishment and self-efficacy

researchCitations.study: Dunlosky et al. (2013) - Psychological Science in the Public Interest
researchCitations.finding: Distributed practice (daily studying) improves retention by 200% vs cramming
Active retrieval practice (testing yourself) doubles long-term retention vs re-reading
Focused study sessions of 90-120 minutes produce disproportionate skill gains

commonBarriers: Forgetting what was studied (no active recall)
progressionPlan: Week 1-2: 20-30 min daily, establish time/place, eliminate distractions. Week 3-4: 45-60 min, use Pomodoro technique (25 min focus, 5 min break). Week 5-8: 60-90 min, incorporate active recall and spaced repetition, track tangible progress (courses completed, concepts mastered).
nooLifeFeatureHighlight: Track daily study time. Pomodoro timer in Assets screen for focused sessions. GTA-style knowledge-building visuals. Contributes heavily to Wisdom, Focus, and Discipline ratings. See study streaks build over 66 days.
testimonial: "Couldn't study more than 15 min without distraction. NooLife's tracking + Pomodoro timer changed the game. Passing my certification because of this." - Kevin H.
ctaAngle: Build a consistent study habit with Pomodoro timers and tracking. Free 3-day trial.
